docs.title: mkdocs_skeleton
docs.text:
This project is a skeleton base for a Github project that includes an mkdocs documentation site (hosted using Github Pages).

To create this project, the following was performed:

docs.title: Install Required Packages
docs.text: You can view the required packages from environment.yml

docs.title: Create MKDocs Project Files
docs.text:
Activate your python environment (with necessary packages installed), then run the following in the from the project folder:

mkdocs new .

Then, inside the newly-created mkdocs.yml file in your project, add the following (at minimum): theme: name: material

docs.title: Publish Site
docs.text:
Run the following (from the directory containing mkdocs.yml file):

mkdocs gh-deploy --force

docs.title: Push Changes & Wait
docs.text: Push all your changes to the remote (main) repository. It make take a few minutes for your site to become active.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
